diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +34,38 @@about:
  home: http://exofrills.org/
  license: WTFPL v2
  summary: exofrills text editor

comments.body:
We need to be super careful here - conda does not do what you (or I) would expect. Sure, conda will decide to build with a `python >=3.4`, but the Python that is used to `build` the package is _not_ necessarily the python that is used to `run` the package.
Adding another line which states `python x.x` is necessary (I think both in the run and in build sections, but you can test that by looking at the build string and observing a `py34`/`py35` suffix)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +23,27 @@    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >=3.4
    - python x.x
    - urwid >=1.1.1

comments.body:
I guess we would typically also add a sha256 to assert that somebody malicious hasn't man-in-the-middled you, but it isn't a deal breaker. If you also put the version in the filename, that would stop conda build from thinking it already has the file in its cache. i.e. this section becomes:

```
source:
  fn: xo-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  # We haven't tagged this version yet, so we get it from the commit directly.
  url: https://github.com/scopatz/xo/archive/8f486a2709d376d00f98c09a86179bce2a99099a.tar.gz
  sha256: whatever
```
Sorry, tapped ctrl+enter by accident. I edited my last message, hope you got all of that.
